intro: Hydrophyllum erectum, commonly known as the tall hempweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. Hydrophyllum erectum is often found in regions with temperate climates and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
